required_documents: Formal letter from CPA (for Non-Public companies)
eligibility_criteria: The successful bidder must have a minimum of three (3) years of business in Temporary Staffing Services at time of bid due date.
a. Agency background, services provided and number of years in business.
b. Applicant/employee testing conducted by agency.
C. Employee training conducted by agency.
education, skill-level, professionalism, flexibility, and communication skills.
able-bodied workers who are no less than eighteen (18) years of age, sober, reliable, clean, and appropriately dressed for the position.
background check on all temporary employees sent to MHMR.
no temporary employee will arrive on MHMR premises with any type of firearms or weapons, drugs, or alcohol.
must be able to work in public areas, as well as be ready and willing to follow instructions of Supervisors.
must provide one, or a combination, of the general categories of temporary staffing positions
must indicate each position for which they can provide temporary staffing services.
Company is financially stable and able to provide related services in its entirety
Company has a minimum of three (3) references (within the last twelve (12) months) related to the type of services or products specified in this RFP
Company has experience with other services or products akin to those described herein

Company has a principal place of business, length of existence, breadth of experience and expertise, management structure, and any other information that demonstrates relative qualifications and experience
Company has not had any contracts terminated due to non-performance over the last five (5) years
Company has not been involved in performance related litigation, arbitration, or mediation over the last five (5) years
Company has not had any adverse actions or sanctions by any regulatory authorities over the last five (5) years
compliance with Immigration and Reform and Control Act of 1986, as amended
enrollment and use of E-Verify system
completion of Form I-9 for employees
proof of eligibility to work in the United States
proposal: Proposals must be submitted by the specified closing date and time

No additional information will be released until after MHMR has completed evaluations for the submitted proposals and an award has been made and approved by Executive staff and MHMR's Board of Trustees, as applicable
Proposals must be submitted in writing
Proposals must be emailed to Randall Elder at mhmr.purchasing@mhmrtc.org
Contractors are responsible for reviewing MHMR's website and retrieving all related documents prior to the RFP's due date
Proposals must be signed in ink by an authorized person
Proposals must be submitted in a sealed envelope
Proposals must be addressed to the attention of: MHMR PROCUREMENT SERVICES, ATTN: RANDALL ELDER, 3840 HULEN STREET, SUITE 538, FORT WORTH, TEXAS 76107
Proposals must state RFP 25-008 TEMPORARY SERVICES DO NOT OPEN UNTIL THURSDAY, FEBRUARY 27, 2025, AT 2:00 P.M.
Proposals must specifically address each element and requirements listed throughout this RFP
Clarifying information is required for all exceptions, deviations, or alternatives provided in the proposals

1. In the bid response, the Contractor shall include a description of the following items: a. Agency background, services provided and number of years in business. b. Applicant/employee testing conducted by agency. C. Employee training conducted by agency.
2. Position specifications for the types of personnel needed by MHMR are listed on the bid Proposal Form. Use the Proposal Form to quote hourly billing rates for each specified position.
3. Pricing must be complete. All bids must include hourly billing rates charged to MHMR for each job position.

13. Contractor(s) shall provide a timesheet which the temporary employee and MHMR supervisor will complete on a weekly basis. a. Submitted timesheets MUST be approved by the MHMR supervisor prior to payment. b. Time sheet must be attached to the invoices submitted to MHMR for payment. C. Separate invoices must be sent for each employee. d. Invoices must have the correct contract rates and indicate the following: job position, start date, and end date for each week billed on invoices. e. Contractor(s) may invoice weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly.

22. Referencing the Exhibit 1, Contractors(s) must provide a list of positions that can be fulfilled by Contractor for temporary staffing services with a breakdown of prices for those services that include: a. An Hourly Rate that would be paid to the temporary staff worker. b. A Billing Percentage that will be applied to the Hourly Rate. C. The Billed Hourly Rate which will include the Hourly Rate plus the Contractor's Contract Rate combined for that particular position.
Proposals must be submitted by 2:00 P.M. on Thursday, February 27, 2025
Proposals must be submitted at 3840 Hulen Street, Suite 538, Fort Worth, Texas 76107
Submittals shall be on 8 1/2 inch by 11 inches, bound, stapled, or in a binder, with a Table of Contents and all pages numbered
Each section shall be clearly identified and tabbed
Tab 1 - Cover Letter - A brief introductory letter of representation
Tab 2 - Executive Summary - A brief summary highlighting the most important points of the Proposal, not exceeding five (5) pages
Tab 3 - Company Background Information
Tab 4 - Financial Consideration
Tab 5 - References and Attachments A, C, D, E, and F
Proposals must include a list of at least three (3) references (within the last twelve (12) months) related to the type of services or products specified in this RFP

Submit company background information including principal place of business, length of existence, breadth of experience and expertise, management structure, and any other information that demonstrates relative qualifications and experience
Project Manager OR Account Representative - Identify the proposed Project Manager or Account Representative and include a resume
Include an organization chart of the proposed Management Team including key personnel and their specific roles
Address any performance related litigation, arbitration, or mediation the company may be, or has been, involved in over the last five (5) years
Identify whether the company has had any contracts terminated due to non-performance over the last five (5) years
Identify adverse actions or sanctions by any regulatory authorities over the last five (5) years
Include a statement that all products and services quoted in the proposal are in full accord with the specifications listed
Proposals must clearly define the company's role, participation, responsibility, plan design and implementation strategy
Must include a project schedule that clearly defines tasks, responsibilities, an estimated time commitments from the agency, and critical milestones
Must include a comprehensive training plan and designated trainer available to offer multiple training
Include brief notes referencing specific line items for explanation in Tab 8 - Proposal Pricing and Delivery
Itemize pricing for all items requested in this proposal in Tab 8 - Proposal Pricing and Delivery
Submit a Contractor Proposal Form and Acknowledgement Form as required
Include illustrative or descriptive literature, brochures, specification, drawings, diagrams etc. in Tab 7 - Descriptive Literature
Proposals must be submitted prior to the deadline
Late modifications will not be considered
Proposals with knowledge of errors or omissions in the RFP are prohibited from using them as an advantage
Report significant errors, omissions or inconsistencies to MHMR no later than 5 days before proposal submission deadline
Proposals must be valid for 120 calendar days after the proposal opening.
Proposals must be received by the stated deadline
Proposals must contain all required components
Proposals must not contain materially false, incorrect, misleading, or incomplete statements
Proposals must not have errors, omissions, or oversights of a material nature
Revisions and/or additional information will be provided via fax or email
Oral presentations may be required for further clarification
Proposals shall be open to public inspection after opening
Confidential or proprietary information shall be conspicuously marked as such
Proposals must be valid for 120 calendar days after the proposal due date
Proposals become the property of MHMR and shall not be returned
Proposals must include a Notice 'No Bid' Form (Attachment B) indicating whether they can or cannot provide the products, supplies, and/or services listed in this RFP
No reimbursement for proposal preparation and submission expenses
No reimbursement for oral presentation costs
Proposals must include the Deviation Form
The Deviation Form must be signed by a representative with the authority to execute contracts
Exceptions to the terms and conditions must be expressly stated in the Deviation Form
Proposals must contain complete and accurate pricing.
Provide a copy of their Maintain Company page from E-Verify to prove enrollment

Provide an electronic or hard copy screenshot of either the confirmation screen or the tentative non-confirmation screen containing the E-Verify case verification number for attachment to the Form I-9 for the three most recent hires
Proposals must include the proposal and/or purchase order number on the invoice
Proposals with payment terms of less than thirty (30) days will not be accepted
Complete Form W-9 and submit with Proposal Documents
Provide best offer/proposal initially and not anticipate discussions to make best offer/proposal
Authorized Signature is required
Title is required
Date is required
insurance: pay all taxes and insurance required by Federal, State, and Local laws
Contractor is responsible and liable for the safety, injury, and health of its personnel while they are performing the temporary services on MHMR property.
Certificate of Insurance as required herein
supplier_diversity_requirements: Utilize Historically Underutilized Business (HUBs) in contracts
Submit proof of Historically Underutilized Business 'HUB' state certificate
Submit Attachment A if intending to subcontract services to HUBs
Utilize Minority/Women and/or Disadvantaged Businesses (M/W/DBEs) in contracts

NOTICE "NO BID" FORM - PLEASE RETURN THIS FORM ONLY TO:, ATTACHMENT D
NON-COLLUSION AFFIDAVIT OF CONTRACTOR - PRINTED NAME

Contractor shall pre-qualify the prospective candidates to determine acceptability and ability to meet the requirements of the assignment, including, but not limited to, qualifiers such as: education, skill-level, professionalism, flexibility, and communication skills.
Contractor(s) shall conduct a background check on all temporary employees sent to MHMR.
MHMR reserves the right to conduct additional background checks on any temporary employee.
MHMR reserves the right to request a copy of the Contractors' background check of temporary employees.
Contractor(s) shall ensure MHMR that no temporary employee will arrive on MHMR premises with any type of firearms or weapons, drugs, or alcohol.
MHMR reserves the right to interview temporary employee(s) prior to being assigned.
MHMR reserves the right to control the details of the temporary employees' work while assigned to MHMR.
MHMR reserves the right to decline the services of any temporary worker provided by a Contractor for any reason, with or without cause or notice.

Submit company background information including principal place of business, length of existence, breadth of experience and expertise, management structure, and any other information that demonstrates relative qualifications and experience.
Address any performance related litigation, arbitration, or mediation the company may be, or has been, involved in over the last five (5) years.
Identify whether the company has had any contracts terminated due to non-performance over the last five (5) years.
Identify adverse actions or sanctions by any regulatory authorities over the last five (5) years.

Tab 7 - Descriptive Literature - Illustrative or descriptive literature, brochures, specification, drawings, diagrams etc., that provide additional Contractor/product information regarding issues addressed in other areas of Contractor's proposal.
The BAFO request may warrant additional discussion.
